resources.string: As of Android 6.0 (Marshmallow), Google no longer allows apps to get access to this permission from your device itself. Now, you need to manually grant this permission from an external computer running macOS/Windows/Linux. It will only be used for things such as toggling your phone\'s \"Show Touches\" setting.
Go to your phone\'s settings -> About Phone (under \"System\" on Android 9) -> Tap the \"Build Number\" seven times or until you see a message saying \"you are a developer\".
Go to your phone\'s settings -> Developer Options -> Enable USB Debugging. Plug your phone into your computer, and grant your computer access to your phone in the dialog that opens on your phone.
